body.name: Johnson & Johnson Red Cross First Aid-to-Go Mini First Aid Kit, 12 Count (Pack of 48) total count 576
body.stockDetail: Only 14 left in stock - order soon.
features: Contains 12 essential first aid items including wipes, bandages, and gauze pads
Durable plastic first aid kit case
Portable design for travel ; Packaging may vary as per stock availability
Some items contain natural rubber latex
body.description: Includes essential first aid items and supplies such as BAND-AID Brand Adhesive Bandages, hand cleansing wipes, and BAND-AID Brand of First Aid Products Gauze Pads in a durable plastic case that fits in your pocket, backpack, gym bag, or suitcase to care for minor cuts and scrapes.

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank
productInformation.value: #60,443 in Health & Household (See Top 100 in Health & Household) #157 in First Aid Kits (Health & Household) #4,139 in Sales & Deals

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good for Blessing Bags
reviews.reviewText: I travel for work and hand out blessing bags to the homeless. This is a good option that has a lot of stuff they may need so I add them for these people in need.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Shame on you Band Aid
reviews.reviewText: The description 12 count, pack of 48 is very misleading. I have trusted the Band Aid brand for many years. One of my best childhood memories is of the “stuck on Band Aid” commercial. So when I went to purchase this to put in 48 care bags that I am putting together for a local homeless shelter, I like others here thought that I was getting 48 pks each containing 12 items. It is very misleading that the description would take an individually packaged product and combine the content amount of 4 individually package products to get to the total of 48. In regards to cost, I thought maybe there was a surplus of this and it was being discontinued and that’s why the cost was so low. Very disappointing Band Aid.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect & great price!
reviews.reviewText: I got these to put in bags to hand out to the homeless & they're perfect!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Very misleading description
reviews.reviewText: We are VERY disappointed in the misleading description of this item. We wanted to buy these in bulk to include in homeless packages. We ordered by mobile app and it said nothing about this being a 4 pack with 12 items in each which equals the 48 (for which we thought were 48 kits with 12 items in each.) It even said 52 cents per item. Who pays 52 cents for one bandaid? And who wants to pay over $6 for this crummy little kit? Definitely returning immediately and we'll have to find another source to help the homeless.Edit: And now we are told we are unable to return these. Over $6 for each kit.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for small hiking packs.
reviews.reviewText: Bought for my students for small hiking packs. Excellent decision!!! Small, compact and full of exactly what you need in small "need a bandaid" situation.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars 48 Pieces NOT Pack of 48
reviews.reviewText: Extremely disappointed. When it says pack of 48 and price tag of $75, you expect a lot more. 4 mini kits was not what I was imagining being able to put in bags for the homeless. I was hoping to be able to help a lot more people. I suppose it was my fault for not reading all the FAQ questions. NOWHERE in the description did it say 4 mini packs. The kits are nice, but the sale is misleading and I will not buy from this 3rd party store again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nice kit for giveaways box is a little large for contents
reviews.reviewText: A small first aid kit that is nice for purse/car. Case is a little large for the items it contains, but it allowed me add a few extra bandaids, and a small pill holder with asprin for my purse. We give away these at tradeshows and find them to a popular item. Others have made similar comments regarding it allows for a few more things to be added. Great price!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars The kits are handy
reviews.reviewText: These were advertised as quantity was 12 kits. Only 4 were sent.
